newsitem.title: MEXICO: Two hurt in Mexico explosion, 2000 evacuated.
newsitem.headline: Two hurt in Mexico explosion, 2000 evacuated.

text.p: About 2,000 people were evacuated from a central neighborhood in the western city of Guadalajara Monday after an underground explosion injured two people, Mexican authorities said.

Jalisco state Civil Protection official Armando Duran told reporters an underground chamber containing equipment belonging to the Federal Electricity Commission (CFE) and Telefonos de Mexico exploded when two inspectors engineers opened it.

Civil Protection chief Arturo Paz Garcia said the blast was caused by a short-circuit which caused a spark and ignited unidentified gases that had accumulated in the chamber. He said there was no risk of further explosions and no gasoline had been detected.
Guadalajara was the scene of a huge series of gasoline explosions in the city sewer system in April 1992 which killed at least 208 people.
